body.p:
A few weeks after we were delighted
with Dr. Cohns maiden sermon, he gave us his woman Sermon, taken
as his text from דברים לא י"ב הקהל את העם הַקְהֵל אֶת הָעָם and proving therefrom, that.
man woman, girls &c &c are not only bound allowed to unite and hear the word
of God, yet they are bound according this text, to do so. He complaint
of our religion as having for such a length of time excludet woman from
so many privileges, to which they are rightously entitled, but that the time
has come when we remedy such an evil, in short he exaltet the ladies
to such a degree, he spoke so much of their greatness, that the congrega
tion did not think themselves to be in a Synagogue, but in the heaven amongst
angels, even the ladies were taken by surprise, as they never were aware
before of their being so very great. The ימים ה"נ had set in fairly, Ladies &
gentlemen appeart together like in a theater, yet it works well as the peop
le here, are enlightened enough to know, how to behave in the house of
God, even before Dr. Kohn was here. The Dr. preached a splendit sermon
on the first day of רה"ש in German, reminding the Cong. for the sake of
our holy religion, to keep the Sabath—which had till the present day
no effect—, than he implored the blessings of heaven for all and every
one, here and anywhere else, the orthodox even not excepted. He did not
forget the death, and every one was moved to tears, as the Dr. has got a
great talent to press them out, of the most stony heart—the second
day he preached in German english, also, first rate. The פיוטים
were all read—the שחרית of the first day was read by the Dr.)—bit in
שחרית the מוסף were omitted and the Cong. Were taken by sur
prise, as they could not pray the מלכויות זכרונות, as the מוסף שמיני בלחש com
menced חזן and right off Shemona esra bekol—. The synagogue
was crowdet, and the service a splendid one, the Haphthora
on the first day was read by the Dr. in German, on the second day
by some person else in hebrew. Yom Kipur we were delighted with
3 sermons all listened at with great awe, the service was conducted
like heretofore, and the day passed away delightfult, and to the
satisfaction of all. Luckas? passed away very pleasantly, the Dr

preached on the first day, explaining the comandment of the feast and
of the קדיש, although there is but one ארבע מיניםארבע מינים in the Congregation,
& one אתרוג v לולב in the Yard of the Synagogue, that'll do for all—on
סוכה, also ערב רה"ש וי"כ, there was even no הושענה רבה in the Synagogue Ema
nuel, as the Dr. Rabbi did not attend even himself, but in the former
years, there were these days well attented service, however now, as
the Rabbi does not attend his followers will do the same.—On Sun
day the מנין inst. The yearly meeting of the Cong. Em. took place, also
the election of officers as much as I understand, it passed of very
quiet, Mr H Seligman was reelected President, and indeed he de
serves reelection, as he is a perfect Gentleman, doing Justice to all pastors,
Mr Sachs vicpres. Reelected, the other officers I do not know, who was
elected. A Resolution, extenting the Term of Office as Rabbi of the Cong from 3 to 5 years, passed unanimously, as such was provided
to the Dr. prior to his arrival here. A communication from the Dr
K. changing the reading of the Thora from one year to three years was
read, a warm debate ensued, and after the same was adopted by the
majority of one, it was further agreed upon that a Comittee of 5
be appointed, to converse with the Dr. whether it was not a great wrong
to adopt such a change, and if the Rabbi succeeds in considering the
same, to the contrary, in the 3 years Cyclus? can שבת בראשית. One of
the Com. refered the Rabbi to the שולחן ערוך, which the latter rejects as
being in any no way his authority, he does not aknowledge the ש"ע con
sequently the Dr showed that some 700 years ago, it was customary
to read the Thora through once in three years, and so it is, or will
be established to the notion of the Dr שמיני עצרת he spoke in his sermon
about the matter, but could not satisfy those who are opposed to it, he
urged also the speedy adoption of the new תפילה (Herzbachers) but not
withstanding, there are only two of them here and none to be had in N. Y.
is that not strange, that of so great an artikel, only li a limited amount
was printed.—Well I suppose the Cong. Em. Did not dream that there
ever another Cong. will be foolish enough to adopt the same—and see
Cong. Em. in the next—. The Dr. spoke also in his service again of the
necessity, of abolishing מוסף, we do not intend to go to ירושלים to bring
קרבנות said he, for us there is no משיח, we live happy here, and enjoy
all privileges we wish to enjoy, we wish not to bend for a jewish King.
I think the Dr is right, because in ירושלים, he could not get $3000 a year

body.p:
nor would he get a house furnished so fine and gratis like here, besides
a couple a hundred Dollars, רה"ש gift.—ירושלים and משיח are two ob
jects which are despised in the heart of the Dr. he would not say ותחזני
in יעלה ויבוא, זכרון משיח בן דוד not ובכן תן כבוד__but Sir there
are thank God, a good many in the Cong. Em. Who think quite otherwise
and although in the minority, yet they will live and die for their religious
principle, as already steps have been taken, to establish a new ועריכת נר לבן ישי משיחנו, which
will and must be done ere long, and beyond doubt with success—
One thing is strange, the Dr says there are no more קהל in the present
time as he goes into כהנים, yet he performed a sample? of week,
ago the ceremony of בית הקברות what inconsistency!—One thing is to
be regretted, that is, the Cong. Em. Has since its existence some 8 or 9 years
lived in most astonishing peace and harmonie, which fact is shown by
its prosperity, they have expendet for a Synagogue over 35000 Doll, for a
new grave yard on 20000 Doll. and she is out of debts and has on 230
members, and now one man has by his actions, created disharmonie, quarells
and private difficulties, between its members, between former friends, men
of long standing intimacy, are now enemies, because they think now diffe
rently on religious question פדיון הבן. One more fact worth of notice
is, that when the Board of Officers on the new burial ground met, to make
laws for the government of the same, the question rose, who is entitled to be
buried in a jewish graveyard, whether children of jewish parents not cir
cumcised, are איכה א', טז' על אלה אני בוכיה עיני עיני, the Dr. was consulted, and he said, that children of je
wish parents even if not circumcised are יהודים—אוי לרשע—
However, there are but two such instances known in this city, where parent do
not circumcise. There were besides the next regular synagogue יהודים
on the שארית ישראל some four more meetings of worship well attende, the ימים ה"נ
מנהג פולין was crowdet and well conducted, and it made me feel well to
hear the prayers chanting in the old established usage and see the greatest or
der and devotion prevail; their minister Dr. Henry, a pious and learned Ger
man, preached a most impressive sermon on the first day of שארית ישראל. The Congre
gation is in a flourishing condition, counts some 80 members, and they have purchased a piece of ground to erect a רה"ש for themselves for
which purpose more than 1500 Doll. Were donated on בית הקברות. Their the י"כ
בית המדרש, some 30 members their service was recording their rite, it was well
attented, so were the balance, all of which I paid a flying visit?. Dr. Eck
man had a service for the children only, which he called חפצי בה, it was
well adapted for his purpose, and the children showed much improvement
in hebrew reading and prayers—The Israelites are rapitly increasing
all over the state, every where is the feeling for our cause alive, in Sacra
mento, Stockton, Marysville, Nevada, Grass Valley &c & every where they kept

body.p:
divine service on the י"ה, without being affected by reform—On the first
day of רה"ש and on י"כ I counted but three jewish Stores open, that is well
worth mentioning, and shows that Judaism is not declining in spite of
a few reformers,—such matters have happened before והמצילנו מידם בכל דור ודור
ובכל זאת על מי אנו תחשעו על אבינו שבשמים The Cong. Emanuel think of selling their present Sy
nagogue and building a great Temple, when final action should take
place in this matter I let you know.—The tenth anniversary Ball
of the Eureka benevolent Soc. took place on the 9th inst. I spend a half
an hour there, it was a splendit affair, leaving the Socit? some 1200 Doll
profit, I think that the Eureka is the most flourishing benev. Society
in the State, has got nearly 300 members, one a Capital of 18000 Doll, and they
doing great great charity.—There are also two Bner? Beris Societys
here, one works in english in existence a couple of years, and another one
works in german, established but 3 months and promises to be a very
important one, as it counts already some 280 members, both lodges are in
deed a great honor to h our nation—There are two Gentlemen in our
city worth of notice, one, Senator Benjamin of Louisiana attenting the ce
lebrated New Alexander case, and the other Benjamin II the travelor
the latter is here a few months, awaiting some assistance from our co
religionist, to proceed to China, to hunt for our last brothers—but until
news, he has not met with any success, neither do I think that he will,
people here think, they can do better with their charity—

Rev Sir! I have given to you in this communication a true statement
of every thing concerning our coreligionists at this place and else
where, you may ? take from it all that suits you, and I'll keep
you posted of every thing of importance, assuring you, that the true
faith of our ancestors, finds a great many supporters here, and were
it not for Dr. Kohn, reform |: destruction of our ancient faith, so dead it/
would never have rooted here, but Hebrew.—What was
the doings of the Dr. K. in Brandenburg?—of which you referred some times
ago in your paper? Asuring you my sincere friendship, I remain
Sir yours with high esteem

P.P. I knew Dr. Wise? I mean Isaac Wise—
some twenty years ago, when he was Schoolteacher
in Tachau in Böhmen, then he did not dream, of being a Dr Divinity in America
or writing a Jewish History, or to become once a traveller for the cause of the
destruction of our ancient faith—.
